CatDescriptText: Mr. E. A. McIntosh, salesman, Brentwood, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "What do you think of race relations here in Pittsburgh?" Answer reads: "I think that race relations here a very favorable. In fact, I've never heard of any incidents.  And it's hard for me to see why people can't get along with each other.  I went through grade school with Negro boys and girls and there was no trouble."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of E. A. McIntosh standing in front of building with "for rent" and real estate signs in window, and Harmony Milk truck in background
